intro: Echites acutilobus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed echites, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and narrow, lobed leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Echites acutilobus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
